Authors: Hutagaol B.A., Abdilah L., Jaya S.U.R., Wang G.
Title: Adoption of mobile smartphone attendance system based on case study of PT XYZ
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Trends in Computer Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hutagaol, B.A., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Abdilah, L., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Jaya, S.U.R., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wang, G., Information Systems Management Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: PT XYZ is the largest outdoor adventure manufacturing and retailing company in Indonesia with more than 3000 employees. To meet the needs of salary calculation, every working day all employees are required to attend work during work hours and after work hours using a fingerprint machine. With a fingerprint machine that is currently owned and the number of employees of more than 3000 people causes long queues during the attendance process. Not to mention if there are technical problems such as unreadable fingerprints or machine fingerprint errors, the attendance process will take longer. This can cause the start time to work backwards and not on time. Therefore we need a attendance system that can speed up the attendance process. The purpose of building a smartphone-based attendance system is so that employees can directly attend attendance via smartphones owned without having to attend through the fingerprint machine. The presence system will be built using android technology and intranet wifi networks. Intranet wifi networks are used to connect smartphones and servers. The intranet network was also chosen so that the attendance system coverage is limited to the PT XYZ factory environment, in order to avoid absent employees from outside the company. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Android; Attendance Applications; Attendance System; Mobile Smartphones
References: Irawan, A., Sistem Infromasi Absensi Mahasiswa (Studi Kasus Jurusan Administrasi Bisnis Poliban) (2014) Jurnal INTEKNA, 2, pp. 102-209; Praveen, K.K.D., (2016) Mobile Phone Mode Conversion and Location Application for Android; Pressman, R., (2010) Software Engineering: A Practitioner’s Approach, , New York: McGrawHil; Eko, W., (2017) Sistem Presensi Mahasiswa Dengan Fingerprint Berbasis Website, , Surakarta: Universitas Muhammadiyah Surakarta; Muhammad, N.A., Wibowo, F.S.R.P., (2013) Pembuatan Aplikasi Presensi Perkuliahan Berbasis Fingerprint, , Surabaya: Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember
Publisher: World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering
Abbreviated Source Title: Int. J. Adv. Trends Comput. Sci. Eng.

Authors: Simanjuntak H., Hutajulu D., Manurung E., Hutagaol B.
Title: Similarity assessment of unified modeling language class diagram using tree edit distance algorithm
Affiliations: Department of Informatics Engineering, Institut Teknologi Del, Toba Samosir, 22381, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Simanjuntak, H., Department of Informatics Engineering, Institut Teknologi Del, Toba Samosir, 22381, Indonesia; Hutajulu, D., Department of Informatics Engineering, Institut Teknologi Del, Toba Samosir, 22381, Indonesia; Manurung, E., Department of Informatics Engineering, Institut Teknologi Del, Toba Samosir, 22381, Indonesia; Hutagaol, B., Department of Informatics Engineering, Institut Teknologi Del, Toba Samosir, 22381, Indonesia
Abstract: In the design stage of software development, engineers often find large collection of models. Lack of management and maintenance of model led to duplicate or redundant model, ineffective reuse, and aggravated maintenance effort. Model matching or similarity is the core of operations management for different models such as models of evolution, consolidation, and retrieval. An accurate identification of the similarity and differences between the elements of the matched models leads to an accurate model of matching, which, in turn, leads to better management models. In this paper, we presents Tree Edit Distance Algorithm to assess the similarity of UML Class Diagram based on XML document of model. Experiment results shows that the algorithm provides similarity value based on number operations (rename, insert, delete) required to transform a class diagram structure into another class diagram. © 2015, American Scientific Publishers. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Class diagram; CTree edit distance; Model matching; Similarity
References: Grady, B., (1994) Object-Oriented Analysis and Design with Applications, , Second edn, Addison-Wesley Professional, California; Will, T., Reuse, S., (1988) Emerging Technology, , IEEE Computer Society Press, New York; Reidar, C., Bernhard, W., (1998) Journal ACM Computing Surveys (CSUR), 30, p. 232; Harjot, K., Manpreet, K., (2014) International Journal of Engineering and Advanced Technology (IJEAT), 3, p. 243; Al-Khiaty, M.A., Ahmed, M., Similarity assessment of UML class diagrams using simulated annealing (2014) 5Th IEEE International Conference on Soft-Ware Engineering and Service Science, pp. 19-23. , ICSESS), Beiking; Al-Khiaty, M.A., Ahmed, M., Similarity assessment of UML class diagrams using a greedy algorithm (2014) Proceeding of the International Com-, pp. 228-233. , ICSEC), Khon Kaen; Tekli, J., Chbeir, R., Yetongnon, K., Computer Science Review (2009) Elsevier Science, 3, p. 151; Nierman, A., Jagadish, H.V., Evaluating structural similarity in XML documents (2002) Proceedings of the 5Th ACM SIGMOD International Workshop on the Web and Databases (Webdb), pp. 61-66; Eugene, M., (1986) An International Journal in Computer Science, Algorithmica, 1, p. 251; Humasak, S., (2015) Proposed Framework for Automatic Entity Relationship Diagram Grading System, , IT Del; Herbert, E., Zhiqiang, G., (2008) Design and Analysis of Algorithms, pp. 11-13. , Duke University, Durham; Dekang, L., An information-theoretic definition of similarity (1998) Proceedings of The, pp. 296-304. , San Francisco; http://www.diffNow.com
